title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 519.13 - Examination of file before hearing
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 519.13 - Examination of file before hearing

State Regulations
(a) If copies of the documentary evidence
which the department plans to use at the hearing have not been provided to the
appellant, or the appellant's representative, an opportunity to examine such
documents, if requested, must be afforded the appellant at the prehearing
conference. (b) The appellant must
be afforded an opportunity to examine the audit file at the prehearing
conference and to make copies of any relevant documents contained in the file
without charge. However, information relating to the selection of the person
for audit, investigation notes or other material which may reveal investigation
techniques, material prepared for submission to a law enforcement or
prosecutorial agency, information concerning law enforcement investigations, or
judicial proceedings or confidential sources or confidential information need
not be revealed. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18
ยง
519.13

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
